title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Generates nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals (Efron & Tibshirani, 1993: https://doi.org/10.1201/9780429246593) standardized regression coefficients (beta) effect sizes, including multiple correlation, semipartial correlations, improvement R-squared, squared partial correlations, differences standardized regression coefficients, models fitted lm().

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: can install CRAN release betaNB : can install development version betaNB GitHub :

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaNB() function betaNB package.

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Fit regression model using lm() function.
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: BetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0728 5000 0.3524 0.6357 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0762 5000 0.2385 0.5332 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0797 5000 0.1039 0.4136

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: betaNB package also functions generate nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals effect sizes RSqNB() multiple correlation coefficients (R-squared adjusted R-squared), DeltaRSqNB() improvement R-squared, SCorNB() semipartial correlation coefficients, PCorNB() squared partial correlation coefficients, DiffBetaNB() differences standardized regression coefficients.

what: Multiple Correlation Coefficients (R-squared and adjusted R-squared)
title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: RSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> RSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> R-squared and adjusted R-squared #> type = "pc" #>        est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> rsq 0.8045 0.0523 5000 0.6933 0.8988 #> adj 0.7906 0.0560 5000 0.6714 0.8916

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DeltaRSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DeltaRSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Improvement in R-squared #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.1859 0.0599 5000 0.0801 0.3131 #> PCTGRT  0.1177 0.0482 5000 0.0350 0.2240 #> PCTSUPP 0.0569 0.0334 5000 0.0084 0.1355

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: SCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> SCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Semipartial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4312 0.0707 5000 0.2830 0.5595 #> PCTGRT  0.3430 0.0722 5000 0.1872 0.4733 #> PCTSUPP 0.2385 0.0708 5000 0.0919 0.3681

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: PCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> PCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Squared partial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4874 0.0986 5000 0.2777 0.6690 #> PCTGRT  0.3757 0.1076 5000 0.1597 0.5853 #> PCTSUPP 0.2254 0.1146 5000 0.0416 0.4713

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Differences of standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1313 5000 -0.1410 0.3700 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1255 5000 -0.0094 0.4826 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1269 5000 -0.1170 0.3806

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan 2023-07-08

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Generates nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals (Efron & Tibshirani, 1993: https://doi.org/10.1201/9780429246593) standardized regression coefficients (beta) effect sizes, including multiple correlation, semipartial correlations, improvement R-squared, squared partial correlations, differences standardized regression coefficients, models fitted lm().

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: can install CRAN release betaNB : can install development version betaNB GitHub :

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaNB() function betaNB package.

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Fit regression model using lm() function.
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: BetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0732 5000 0.3511 0.6388 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0779 5000 0.2358 0.5435 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0800 5000 0.1025 0.4176

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: betaNB package also functions generate nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals effect sizes RSqNB() multiple correlation coefficients (R-squared adjusted R-squared), DeltaRSqNB() improvement R-squared, SCorNB() semipartial correlation coefficients, PCorNB() squared partial correlation coefficients, DiffBetaNB() differences standardized regression coefficients.

what: Multiple Correlation Coefficients (R-squared and adjusted R-squared)
title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: RSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> RSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> R-squared and adjusted R-squared #> type = "pc" #>        est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> rsq 0.8045 0.0515 5000 0.7006 0.8957 #> adj 0.7906 0.0552 5000 0.6792 0.8882

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DeltaRSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DeltaRSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Improvement in R-squared #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.1859 0.0586 5000 0.0803 0.3099 #> PCTGRT  0.1177 0.0493 5000 0.0343 0.2252 #> PCTSUPP 0.0569 0.0344 5000 0.0083 0.1400

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: SCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> SCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Semipartial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4312 0.0692 5000 0.2833 0.5567 #> PCTGRT  0.3430 0.0737 5000 0.1852 0.4745 #> PCTSUPP 0.2385 0.0720 5000 0.0910 0.3742

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: PCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> PCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Squared partial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4874 0.0999 5000 0.2769 0.6693 #> PCTGRT  0.3757 0.1086 5000 0.1580 0.5851 #> PCTSUPP 0.2254 0.1155 5000 0.0411 0.4875

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Differences of standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1342 5000 -0.1599 0.3719 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1253 5000 -0.0115 0.4855 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1285 5000 -0.1173 0.3844

title:
Estimate Differences of Standardized Slopes
and Generate the Corresponding Sampling Distribution
Using Nonparametric Bootstrapping — DiffBetaNB
code: # Data --------------------------------------------------------------------- data("nas1982", package = "betaNB")  # Fit Model in lm ---------------------------------------------------------- object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = nas1982)  # NB ----------------------------------------------------------------------- nb <- NB(   object,   R = 100, # use a large value e.g., 5000L for actual research   seed = 0508 )  # DiffBetaNB --------------------------------------------------------------- out <- DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05)  ## Methods ----------------------------------------------------------------- print(out) #> Call: #> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Differences of standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>                   est     se   R    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1283 100 -0.1579 0.3251 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1271 100  0.0284 0.4791 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1326 100 -0.1146 0.3731 summary(out) #> Call: #> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Differences of standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>                   est     se   R    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1283 100 -0.1579 0.3251 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1271 100  0.0284 0.4791 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1326 100 -0.1146 0.3731 coef(out) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410  vcov(out) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.016459509    0.007515380   -0.008944129 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.007515380    0.016165350    0.008649969 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.008944129    0.008649969    0.017594099 confint(out, level = 0.95) #>                      2.5 %    97.5 % #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.15787042 0.3250606 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP  0.02839849 0.4790846 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.11463617 0.3730821
